    • Method Detail

      • sliderClicked

        public void sliderClicked()
        Method which allows to zoom in/out of the gridpane.

      • updateGridObjects

        public void updateGridObjects()
        Method which updates the 2d array grid objects to allow checks to occur (e.g. if you can place a wall enemy if there is a wall or no wall there)

      • checkEnemyPlacement

        public void checkEnemyPlacement(int yCoord,
                                int xCoord)
        This method checks how many walls are next to the location where the user has chosen to place a wall enemy. It then updates wall count to say how many walls are the near the enemy. If a wall is above, below, to the left or to the right of the enemy then a 1 is added to the corresponding direction in the hash map possibleDirections.
        Parameters:
        yCoord - The y coordinate of the enemy's starting position.
        xCoord - The x coordinate of the enemy's starting position.

      • resetPossibleDirections

        public void resetPossibleDirections()
        This method resets the hashmap so that the wall enemy can move in any possible direction before it's placed on the map.

      • loadBuild

        public void loadBuild(java.lang.String FILE_LOCATION)
        Loads up a custom level file into the editor.
        Parameters:
        FILE_LOCATION - - the string path of the file to edit

      • setIsLoad

        public static void setIsLoad(boolean isLoad,
                             java.lang.String FILE_LOCATION)
        Sets if the file is loaded or not, and the file loaded if so.
        Parameters:
        isLoad - - a boolean stating if it's loaded or not
        FILE_LOCATION - - the location of the loaded file

      • setEnemyDirections

        public void setEnemyDirections(int height,
                               java.lang.String filepath)
        This method updates the enemyDirections 2D array with the starting directions of each enemy in the map we're editing.
        Parameters:
        height - The height of the map being edited, used to reach the end of the file where enemy data is stored.
        filepath - The path of the file which holds the data of the custom map.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(int yCoord,
                         int xCoord,
                         javafx.scene.layout.GridPane board,
                         javafx.scene.Node target,
                         SavedImage trgImage,
                         javafx.scene.image.ImageView piece)
        This method displays a window with a combo box so that the user can select a legal starting direction for the enemy. It makes sure the user doesn't choose a direction which moves the enemy away from the wall. However it does allow the user to choose a starting direction where the enemy can move into a tunnel in between 2 walls. The method also makes sure that the user chooses a legal direction and shows an error alert otherwise.
        Parameters:
        yCoord - y coordinate of the wall enemy.
        xCoord - x coordinate of the wall enemy.
        board - The current map the user is editing.
        target - The location on the map where the wall enemy will be placed.
        trgImage - The image at the location on the map where the wall enemy will placed.
        piece - ImageView at the location on the map where the wall enemy will be placed.

      • setTitle

        public static void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the stored title of the map.
        Parameters:
        title - - the new name for the map
